website_summaries.verdict: Cleans all types of pool surfaces and is smart enough to navigate on its own no matter the size or shape of the pool.
pros: Easy to put together and does a great job cleaning
Removing it from the pool is simple thanks to its handy lift feature
Will surface on its own for easy retrieval
Compact enough to be stored almost anywhere
cons: Very expensive unit that doesn't do a great job with cleaning pool steps
It also sometimes doesn't respond to the included remote

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean, and more intelligent cleaning algorithm.
customer_reviews.text: I have had two other popular robotic cleaners, however, this one is clearly superior. The debris container is super easy to empty and clean vs. a bag. The cleaning algorithm is superior as it covers the whole pool reliably, and does it faster than the others. It climbs the walls easily, and does not get stuck. I really like the remote control option too - not super easy to use, but far better than trying to drag it to the debris spot. If you appreciate my review, please click the Yes button below.
customer_reviews.author: KrisS

customer_reviews.title: Best robot yet
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pool robot I've had over the years. It's clearly the best. The floor and walls of my pool are beautifully sparkling clean. The cord doesn't get tangled. I especially like having it programmable. We came home from 9 days of vacation to a perfectly clean pool. With prior robots, that never was possible. I also like the way this one is lighter weight. My favorite feature is the basket inside that collects the debris. It's a rigid plastic basket that you just spray off and place inside without having to stretch the wet elastic over the square holder on my prior Dolphin robot and so much easier than handling the smelly cloth bags.
customer_reviews.author: laserdoc

customer_reviews.title: What a great company!
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a less than stellar review stating that our Polaris robot had a motor that went outyears, and of course, 3 months after the warranty expired. The part was $600+ at the local pool supply, so we decided to purchase a new one of the same model in case we needed parts in the future. I received a call within a week from Zodiac offering to replace the unit. Wow. That was an amazing call. They discussed the importance of maintaining a good relationship with their customers and standing behind their product. I am sold! I rarely see this effort in corporate America today. I'm a loyal customer for life. Houston TX
customer_reviews.author: david canales

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money just mixes up what is in there.
customer_reviews.text: So we've used this product in our unground pool and it has unsuccessfully cleaned it all. It seems as it motors around it just blows debris around and when all is said and done he debris resettles on the bottom. This costs way too much money for it to do a mediocre job. We've also dropped it in different areas of our pool hoping it would clean that area but it seems to find its favorite path and do it on repeat.
customer_reviews.author: albal

customer_reviews.title: Poor brightness and poor resolution display
customer_reviews.text: The display on the caddy is barely readable in daylight. Poor brightness and poor resolution display. Programming is cumbersome and the most important parameter, cleaning duration time, is fixed and cannot be changed through programming. I use it in manual mode. Much simpler. It cleans well and the feature to get it out of the pool is very helpful. But the unit is extremely heavy, even with no water in it, so when you bend over to lift it out of the pool, be prepared for a heavy lift. And have a good back and be able to touch your toes because you really have to bend to reach it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Cinque

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I had this for 3 years in my saltwater pool. I have 8 oak trees over my pool and this thing can clean. I used to leave it in the pool; however, don't do that because the salt and clorine will dry out the seals and cause corrosion on metal parts. When you are done cleaning put away for the next time. Don't leave it in the pool like I did. Now I have to buy replacement parts. I might just buy another one of these instead. I got rid of my pool guy after I bought him. Talk about a money savor. I paid $140 a month for a pool man that just did the bate minimum.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Best to buy this locally for support.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 4 weeks. Support said take to Leslies. They troubleshot as bad cable, but would not repair it since I didn't buy it there.. why take it there then? After too much of my time with Polaris and Leslies.. took it to another pool supply store for repair. 3 weeks in entire process...still waiting for Polaris to approve repair and send cable.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G

customer_reviews.title: Robots are taking over... and I like it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this robot. I’ve always been a do-it-yourselfer so to give in and go electronic was a big step. What I learned, now I can do many other to-dos while this lil-guy does his. You’ll also find that there’s more debris and particulates that you can’t see from above. Super impressed and would highly recommend to anyone that wants to set it and forget it. The wireless remote is fun, but not a selling point. This lil’guy covers my 28,000 gallon pool in about 90 minutes and about 2 hours if I have him scrub the liner edge (waterline). The entire robot and cabling fits nicely on compact carriage with wheels. This thing is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Bret A. Martine

customer_reviews.title: This is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner is an absolute beast! While it is a bit heavy when you are loading it in and out of the water, once it's in it does an amazing job. It climbs the walls, hits the ledge then drops back down and changes direction. It does not turn over for me as some others have indicated. It also has a very fine screen so it cleans the silt, dirt and algae from the pool that our previous cleaner did not. I have not yet used the hand held remote control so I cannot speak to that but the cleaner itself is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J Marinelli

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This does a great job. On the expensive side, but so far seems worth it. My pool was a mess after the winter and cleaned with no problem, large leaves and twigs included. I recently used to remote to guide it a spot it missed and it was amazing
customer_reviews.author: Jim M

customer_reviews.title: for the cost not very good unit. I would expect it to really clean ...
customer_reviews.text: works some what. cord gets twisted does not clean at corners or seams where sides meet floor. fan unit pushes items out of the way so that the machine does not pick up every thing. does not clean the side walls very well hit and miss. canister is every to clean. for the cost not very good unit. I would expect it to really clean the pool. I still have to brush down the entire sides and corners of the pool not to mention the stair too. why can't the pool cleaner companies make some thing that works like it is suppose to? paid over $1000. for something that does not work like it says.
customer_reviews.author: sherry d.

customer_reviews.title: The best pool cleaner I've seen
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Polaris 360 with this 9550 and I am very pleased! I have a gunite, rectangle pool and the 360 kept getting stuck. I would have to babysit it while it was running. I set the cleaner for bottom only and let it run for 2 hours once or twice a day and I've never seen my pool cleaner. Very happy with this cleaner. The remote is OK and seems more of a gimmick. You tilt the remote to guide the cleaner and that is very clumsy. Should have just put a joystick on it. But it does help when removing the cleaner. If you can get past the price tag, this cleaner is def worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY from UNIT & MANUFACTURE both are  WORTHLESS
customer_reviews.text: WARNING DONT BUY ANY PRODUCT FROM POLARIS OR ONE THATS OFFERED BY AMAZON my pool is only opened for 2 months July & August I pack this unit up perfectly at the end of every season At the beginning (July 2020) I unpacked the unit put in the pool ERROR 10 & ERROR 2 after searching reviews it seems to be an ongoing flaw that the manufacture refuses to address i only used this item a total of 4 months. Stay away from Amazon & zodiac (polaris) they both denied any responsibility If you jyst bought one I PROMISE YOULL EAT IT. RETURN AS SOON AS POSSIBLE
customer_reviews.author: ABE

customer_reviews.title: Cable tangle is a nightmare and my pool is dirty
customer_reviews.text: I love this pool cleaner and think it would be great if they could include a cable that did not completely tangle. First, let me state that I have followed all the instructions. I have even tried laying the cable completely out in the sun. I have tried to not use the entire 60' of cable. However, after each cleaning, it is completely tangled. It is infuriating. In the end, it doesn't actually clean because it can't reach the other side of the pool since the cable is all tangled up. So, unfortunately, this is complete trash. And I have only had this cleaner for 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: Worthless unit
customer_reviews.text: Best pool robot I’ve ever owned (out of 5 different models). This thing cleans great and is a breeze to use, with the exception of the cord, which is so hard to untangle. EDIT: I’m updating my review due to this thing died within the first season. Like many owners I’ve seen on the Internet, I started receiving Error Code 10 repeatedly within the first few months of ownership and now, less than a year from purchase, it’s dead. Polaris doesn’t seem to want to do anything about it. Don’t waste your money. I’m going back to Dolphin. The cool looks and ease of use of the Polaris are worthless if it’s dead.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: The product we got in was DOA. Took it to my local dealer and a few days later product was repaired with new control head and works. It doesn't do as well as I had hoped in that it goes in random patterns and that means it doesn't always cover the entire pool area. The remote while it works is not the easiest to use, but that could just be me. I like the easy out and cleaning the unit is easy. Given electronics today and capabilities I wish it would map out the pool and store the map. I think that would speed the process of cleaning up as it would have a stored mapped route for the pool.
customer_reviews.author: John F Byers

customer_reviews.title: Easy Lift Out of Pool System
customer_reviews.text: What a great pool cleaner. It comes on a cart so you can wheel it to where you need to plug it in. Quiet. No problems with long cord twisting or causing problems. We have a 60' long rectangular pool so needed a cleaner that would go that far. Does the sides and the bottom of pool. Has trouble with our stairs that are higher than most, but stairs were not the problem. Picks up leaves, pollen, and leaves a clean path in its wake. Push the lift out button and it climbs the wall to the top of the pool so you can bend down and lift it out. Expensive, but worth it for us.
customer_reviews.author: SMaxey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good cleaner, but it’s also a pretty hefty price. I do really enjoy having it be self-contained and not hooked into the side of the pool, so I can just wheel it away. It has a hard time covering certain areas of our pool without using the remote. I still have not gotten the remote control to work like it’s supposed to, and it’s fairly difficult to control, but you can get the job done. All in all, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robs

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job - saves me time!
customer_reviews.text: I used my brand new Polaris to open my pool this year. Since I have a porous pool cover, the pool bottom is usually covered with grit by the end of Winter. I found that the Polaris filter clogged quickly and I had to clean it about every half hour. So I gave up and vacuumed the grit off the pool bottom the old fashioned way. Once the grit was gone, I've used the Polaris regularly to clean the bottom and sides of the pool of normal debris, and it does an excellent job. Very easy to clean too. The remote - well, lets just say I'm still learning to use it.
customer_reviews.author: K16kid

customer_reviews.title: Best investment in pool equipment.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cleaner in 2017. The 9550 is still going strong. This is the ONLY pool cleaner I use, and it keeps the pool immaculate. It's also very easy to use. Plug it in, drop it in the pool and hit start. Come back in a few hours to a perfectly clean pool. Whatever the programming is ... it's smart ... it covers every square inch of my pool. This has been the best investment in pool equipment that I've made.
customer_reviews.author: Big Lou in NJ

customer_reviews.title: Major Malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in myself for ordering from Amazon and not a local store. About 1 month after use, MAJOR MALFUNCTION error code ER02 code = Right side traction motor short circuit means we need a new one this one is defective! But I’m certain Zodiac will treat us right as they have in the past. this is our 3rd Polaris for good reason, and nothing beats it
customer_reviews.author: JFROBBINS

customer_reviews.title: Polaris In-Ground Pool Cleaner
customer_reviews.text: The cleaner does a great job, even gets the finest sand off the bottom. I can run two cycles every other day and the pool stays clean. I like the fact that the debris is not going to the main filter unit. It is very easy to clean. I absolutely love the Lift system. The unit comes to the surface and I can retrieve the unit from the pool by myself. It is a tad heavy for an older person. Control unit is easy to operate.. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Luauna E Minten

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted one year. DIY repair cost prohibitive
customer_reviews.text: Constantly getting error codes. Won’t run longer than 10 seconds now. First year was amazing. Never seen a cleaner work this well. Right after the return window closed, the product died. Local pool companies will not work on amazon purchased products and the motor repair is well over 500 just for the part. For the price of this robot, I could have a human clean and supply chemicals on a weekly basis. Even zodiac won’t return my calls. I’m really disappointed. This purchase was a mistake. It is amazing when it works, but it’s a fragile little guy and too expensive to repair :(
customer_reviews.author: Brett Nemeroff

customer_reviews.title: Barely outlasts the warranty
customer_reviews.text: Lasted just over 2 years and now I'm getting Error code 10 which is a communications error. Bought this on the recommendation of a friend who loved it. Shortly after I got mine his broke with the same error code and it cost him $800 to have it repaired. I'm not puttting $800 into a $1000 machine. Should last a little longer than 2 years for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Lasted only 3 years
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner did not work near as well as my old-tech, water-pressure-powered, 3-wheel Polaris. It did not pickup very well at all at the bottom of the walls where the floor rose up to the side wall. It was terrible around the steps. But worst of all, after only 3 years, it needs $1100 worth of repairs! That's about what I paid for it. I am going back to the old tech, 3-wheel, Polaris 360. Don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: SSCH

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Remote programming  is completely backwards.
customer_reviews.text: Great suction. Program for odd shaped pool needs an upgrade but works ok. Our pool is larger than most so we run it twice in two separate areas for the best results . The remote works, but all the motions are counterintuitive, really oddly thought thought out. Lean it backwards to make it go forwards or lean it left to make it go to the right. So annoying. It’s like a sick joke. NOT FUNNY.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Vitale

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and works as described. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and well designed. I have rectangular gunite pool with a stepped entry. The 9550 found every nook, recovered from tumbles when cleaning the steps and scaled the walls to clean the tiles. One disapointment was the slowness of the remote but once you're used to it, all is well. The caddy was very easy to assemble and it comes with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: CatCityRob

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought what I thought was the best electric pool vacuum around. I’m 2 years in with it and finally decided to rate this product. Why? Because it was a very expensive mistake. When it works, it’s awesome. I have had it warrantied several times. Now the warranty is out. The power cable is always the problem. Now that it is out of warranty I am not going to spend $300 plus every two months (that’s how long it has lasted after each repair). So I’m in the market for something else. Non Jandy/ Zodiac. My remote for the pool didn’t last a year and it only had a 90 day warranty. Hopefully my pumps hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Mercer

customer_reviews.title: Great robot for big pools
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. It works on our very large pool and is easy to clean. I run it 2-4 times a week and sometimes spot clean using the remote. You can leave it in the pool but I tend to take it out each night or every other night to make sure it last. The remote works well and honestly for the money savings is probably easier to use than upgrading to the 965.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Wenthe

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Polaris
customer_reviews.text: My 2nd Polaris just gave up to ghost due to fractured/broken floating cable. This on is awesome. Had horrible problem with leaves getting under my cover this winter. In past 3 days I bet I've suctioned 4-6 bushels of leaves from pool. Also unlike the past model this one has swivel/no tangle cord which I'm loving Fast service Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Dr. W. Kirt Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my new robotic cleaner for a couple of weeks now and so far I am over the top happy with it's results. It is saving me the backbreaking chore of scrubbing my pool walls and I no longer have to worry about my vacuum line clogging frequently from the tree droppings in the bottom of the pool. Our pool has never looked better! The remote control takes a little bit of a learning curve. I think directional arrows instead of tilting for direction would be more logical but I understand they are trying to utilize new technology. At this point I have to say great job on this cleaner!
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Jarrell

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay but there are better options
customer_reviews.text: It mostly does the job, but it should be a little better for the price. The shape of the side basket makes it odd to clean and the remote control doesn’t work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mvatk

customer_reviews.title: and it picked up the smallest particles (pollen) and clogged easily - we have A LOT of pollen
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this is a life saver! He used to spend hours a week vacuuming the pool because our budget robotic vacuum missed so much. We have used this for months now, and he has not even had to vacuum by hand once. The filter it came with had very small holes, and it picked up the smallest particles (pollen) and clogged easily - we have A LOT of pollen. So we purchased a filter with slightly larger holes and it's perfect - picks up everything and does not clog. We would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: ErinW

customer_reviews.title: Worked ONE summer. ERROR 10
customer_reviews.text: This cleaner worked great for ONE summer. Summer two and I immediately started getting ERROR 10 and it stopped working. I did all the troubleshooting per the manual and finally took it to a Polaris dealer for warranty work. Although, I had to pay a $25 diagnostic fee. Several weeks went by. The entire control panel was replaced. Brought it home, put it in the pool and within 10 minutes of cleaning....ERROR 10 and it STOPPED working AGAIN. I am very unhappy with this very expensive robot.
customer_reviews.author: ~KNL~

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first after reading mixed reviews. I can confidently say, after 4 months, this was one of the best investments I've made. One thing I would have done differently: I should have purchased the ultra fine mesh filter from the beginning. The additional cleaning power, picking up the fine sand that blows in to the pool from around the foundation work that was done last year, is invaluable. I highly recommend both the Polaris F9550 Sport along with the ultra fine mesh filter sold separately.
customer_reviews.author: DEAndre

customer_reviews.title: My new best friend:)
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! It climbs, turns, cleans our pool great. It can have issues with our steps, but it still gets up in the first level . If it tumbles upside down it corrects itself. Lift system guides it to edge of pool and you just have to help it up that last leg:). Very happy with this cleaner. It was expensive, but I think we made a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lakelady

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed in the company I bought the pool robot from
customer_reviews.text: This product is good. I had the exact model once before. The company that sold me this one last month said it was new and it was not . It was broke and parts were missing. Extremely disappointed in the company.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes pool maintenance easy
customer_reviews.text: We have a very large pool with a tanning ledge. The robot doesn't always get the tanning ledge and when it does it misses areas around the half moon step and the corners. This is only a minor inconvenience. When cleaning by hand these are problem areas for me as well so overall I am quite happy with the performance. As far as the rest of the pool it does a better job than I do with way less effort. By dropping the robot in and letting it go about its business I have much more free time to do other things. If this unit quits I will quickly order another.
customer_reviews.author: Linden Allen

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last and Floats
customer_reviews.text: The filters are junk, they come apart. The cord tangles in 30 minutes, so no need to program, so much for tangle free cord. The cleaner floats to the top of the pool and sits there, even after properly getting all air out when submersed. I bought this "investment" to replace a long time Dolphin, wish i had bought another one.
customer_reviews.author: CBROWN003

customer_reviews.title: I've been replaced by a robot!
customer_reviews.text: Well designed, efficient unit. The cleaner is completely assembled but the stand needs to be put together, which is quite simple. My only quibble is that the display on the control unit seems to be stuck in the 70s with a red LED display that's not too easy to read in the sun. Clearly time for an upgrade here. The sequence for setting the clock and program modes follows the somewhat complicated system. A few well-designed dials would be much more intuitive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Over hyped by Polaris.
customer_reviews.text: We've seen this thing climb stairs twice. We've seen it refuse to climb stairs many dozens of times. Without exception, it misses several spots on the pool bottom. The remote is a challenge to use. It's not light, so my wife and I have a hard time getting it out of the pool. We'd like it better if it worked as good as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase ever!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant at first to spend this kind of money on a pool cleaner but a friend recommended it so I took a chance. I’m glad I did! Halfway through my 4th season and still going strong. Between this guy, (I lovingly named Roberto)and my turbo skimmer I never have to do anything to keep my pool clean. I have a 35,000 gallon kidney shaped in-ground pool. I brush it once after opening and that’s it (unless I have to save a little animal now and again). I use him 5-6 times a week, clean basket out every 2-3 times. If Roberto died tomorrow I would gladly replace him. Takes the work out of pool ownership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!  Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have a large pool that sits under a Live Oak tree so I get a ton of debris in the pool in the spring and fall. I use the regular filter to grab the leaves off the bottom and the fine filter to get the small junk up. The system is easy to use and pretty efficient. Would have given a 5 star but the cord is difficult to deal with, gets tangled very easily. Also, it has a bit of trouble climbing the walls all the way to the top, especially when the basket starts to fill up. Otherwise it’s a great product and definitely worth the big money, saves me a ton of work
customer_reviews.author: RLC

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever and amazon unable to deliver these to us
customer_reviews.text: First the robot was defective and would not do anything except hide in a corner of the pool. We sent it back to amazon and it still is not registering as received even though UPS documents show it was received by amazon days ago. Makes us rethink using amazon for the first time. There’s no way to talk with amazon about it and if you click on customer service you get an automated agent who tells you nothing new. I’d give the entire episode a -10 if I could - don’t buy on amazon now and surely don’t buy a pool robot.
customer_reviews.author: sdjk

customer_reviews.title: Love the product.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this model because the people who open our pool recommended it. Also, we had an old Polaris system in the past, which lasted many years. My only negative was that the remote control we purchased with this model, which cost a couple of hundred dollars extra, was kind of worthless. I would recommend buying the less expensive model without the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Fenstermaker

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: We got the especially for the pool opening and it made it exponentially easier. I have a 20x40 ft in-ground pool and it runs through it and does the water line no issues. I haven’t had any problems with the line tangling. Cleaning the filter is a snap pretty much like a regular vacuum. I have not used the remote but my husband did and it was paired in the factory and so far has worked fine. The lift feature brings it right to the top to clean it. I can lift it over the edge of the pool without a lot of trouble. I will say we have only had this a week but so far it’s working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected it to be. If your pool get leaves, dirt...etc frequently and you need to use if frequently using the Polaris at least 2-3 times weekly is recommended, and emptying its basket a couple of times during 2 hour cleaning will probably be necessary. Its vacuuming power is very reasonable and its remote control does exactly what it says in the manual. Worth the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer 74

customer_reviews.title: They have pretty much solved the cord becoming twisted during operation and ...
customer_reviews.text: Vastly improved over same model purchased 3 years ago. They have pretty much solved the cord becoming twisted during operation and the ability to clean walls has been greatly improved. The previous model would turtle almost every cycle this one has had no issues after 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: james morgan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't climb wall.
customer_reviews.text: Mine was defective. It would only climb the wall 10% of the time for some reason. Polaris tech support was no help. I waited three weeks for delivery, and when I tried to replace it I was not able to and could only return for a refund, per Amazon. Instead Amazon is making me purchase it again for $300 more if I want it? Doesn't seem right. I wanted to product, I just didn't want a defective one. Now Amazon is sticking it to me because I don't already spend a ton of money there?
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! 2 year warranty just ended and cleaner hasn’t made it through year # 2. Have used this cleaner basically 6 months and it won’t power on. When it was working like another negative review i’ve read, it did just blow small debris around then it would settle and need to be sucked up again by hand defeating the point of having the robot! I did also (like the other customer stated) bought a finer filter that didn’t do the trick! Money down the drain not worth the nearly 1,000 it cost booooo!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Over all it works GREAT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is awesome on this cleaner, but I wish the remote control worked better and was easier to control. Would be nice if there was a remote with directional arrows, instead of the sensor. UPDATE: After struggling with my remote control, I noticed on the display of the caddy, it said " LOW" I thought it could be the batteries that came already installed for the remote. I could not find anything about this " LOW" message online or in the manual. I decided to change the remote control batteries and the :"LOW" message went away and the remote now works just as it should. It works great. 8/23/19...
customer_reviews.author: Randy S-

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but so is a pool
customer_reviews.text: This is expensive for sure. I used it all summer and it did a great job. Hope it will last for several years. The filter seems sturdy, I clean it each time and have not had issue with it tearing. I would not keep this outdoors though. I store indoors which might help with longevity.
customer_reviews.author: msauve

customer_reviews.title: Broke bot!
customer_reviews.text: Owned for 2 years. Had to have control panel and motor replaced/rebuilt 2x. It is now not working again. Error code 10. No longer under warranty and Polaris will not do anything to address issues. Do not recommend ever buying.
customer_reviews.author: shannon melton

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: It arrived earlier than expected, it was easy to assemble and doing a great job on our pool! I’m amazed at how it looks clean but yet how much is in the vacuum filter when it is through! Super happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Oldfield

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; does what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I had the Polaris P955 before the P9350 and the P955 had all the bells and whistles and was very effective but it only lasted about 4 years. The P9350 is much more basic (only 2-wheel drive, no timer, only On or Off, no remote) but it is $500 - $600 cheaper. If the P9350 is reliable and cleans the pool, I will be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relax and have confidence that your pool will remain clean
customer_reviews.text: Amazing machine, I have had 3 different vacuums in my pool in the last nine years. I was about to switch brands from Polaris to anything but Polaris. I used to have to vacuum every day, but now I run my robot maybe 4 times a week, The other nice thing is I don’t have to brush my pool since the robot does it for me. So if you can afford it stop buying the booster pump vacuum and get a robot you will actually have time to swim in the pool and not just maintain it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel A. Montano

customer_reviews.title: Best pool investment ever!
customer_reviews.text: "Wally" (I named him) is phenomenal! Our gunite pool has never looked this good. It even cleans the tile! The pool has large, built in benches that sometimes get cleaned, but sometimes are missed. I don't care. This has cut my weekly pool cleaning time from 3 hours to less than 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS C LIPINSKI

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: First time pool owners here. We purchased this based on our pool guy's recommendation and oddly enough the P9550 was less expensive than the P9450 when we ordered it. Yes, it's a lot of money, but the pool guy was going to charge us $150 for his guys to clean up the pool for us. We've run this baby 3 times now. Easy to use, pool is sparkly clean after an hour. Only 4 more times before it pays for itself.
customer_reviews.author: ruth

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Not even 2 years old and it will not work. Performed all the troubleshooting steps and still have ER10. It had just completed a cleaning cycle and after I cleaned the canister which is installed correctly, I tried to restart the cleaner and it displays the ER10 code. Not happy with this product. This is the second unit I have purchased and I will be looking for a different brand for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great pool robot cleaner
customer_reviews.text: It’s an excellent cleaner. Picks up most dirt and with the remote control it comes back to the edge so you can take it out. I only have to use it once a week. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Norma W

customer_reviews.title: Polaris techs are Jerks
customer_reviews.text: Product worked fine for 2 summers. Pulled it out of the garage on April 21, 2019 and it gave an error code. I callled Polaris to inquire and the representative was an absolute Jerk. I basically waited on hold for 20 minutes for him to tell me to take it to a local retailer and then hang up on me before giving me the names on retailers.
customer_reviews.author: ordinaryguy

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt work on kidney shaped pools nor inclined walls
customer_reviews.text: Did not work as advertised. Doesnt travel the entire pool; therefore I still have dirt spots, does not climb walls of pool, ineffective cleaning machine. very disappointed. We had to do the same amount of cleaning and scrubbing and vacuuming with or without the unit; therefore it is irrelevant and worth only one star.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Westman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Aquabot that we have had for awhile. Great robotic cleaner and SO MUCH EASIER to clean out than the Aquabot. Would highly recommend to anyone with an inground pool.
customer_reviews.author: sandy conley

customer_reviews.title: Polaris 9550 is A Beast
customer_reviews.text: Let me point out that this will not cure your green pool mess or pick up rocks out of your pool. This is for the meticulous soul that wants to maintain a clean pool. It scrubs all surfaces and picks up tiny leaf debris. Highly recommended by my local pool expert. He was not even mad I bought it off Amazon. This is also the best deal you will find out there. Treat it well, and it will treat you well.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Althoff

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use pool cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: Great pool cleaner. It cleans the bottom and the sides, it can climb all the way to the surface. The all purpose filter it came with wasn't the greatest for our pool setup. We don't have any trees so the only things that get in our pool is dirt and a little grass. Once we bought the extra fine filter, it worked great as long as you remember to clean it periodically.
customer_reviews.author: LH00

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself in 6 months. I Have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Paid for itself in 6 months. I Have to leave it running for 2 hours every time I use it due to the amount of leaves it has to pick up but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Rash

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy in PA
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a little over a year ago and realized that it has never really worked correctly in terms of my ability to clean only the bottom of the pool. It climbs the walls on every setting and then flips over and turns off. It has gotten progressively worse but it has never worked correctly and now I am a little over a year out and probably out of warranty......
customer_reviews.author: CYNTHIA JONES

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after having our pool re plastered. This thing works like a champ. I just set the programming and throw it in and it does a phenomenal job. Remote retrieval works great and the caddy keeps it looking clean and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: BRADCREMO

customer_reviews.title: Polaris F9450 poorly cleans pool
customer_reviews.text: Polaris F9450 is in my opinion poorly engineered. The water jet in rear of unit causes pool debris to be blown around pool. The end result, about 30% of the debris settles back on floor of pool.
customer_reviews.author: Al M.

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.  I have tried them all.
customer_reviews.text: I have every type of pool cleaner. Several brands that were much more expensive than this one. It is simply the best. Easy to clean. Clean the entire pool. It works better than any other model I have tried and I have tried them all.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Smith

customer_reviews.title: The ability to not get hung up on strange shaped pools.
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure it was worth the price but after using it for a month, I wish I had taken the leap earlier. It does the walls, the stairs, and doesn’t get hung up on anything. Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Noel K.

customer_reviews.title: Cleans as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I have had other pool cleaners and was disappointed with their cleaning, especially going up walls and steps. This has exceeded my expectations on cleaning, so easy to get in and out, and the storage rack is great. My only worry is the product lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Curley

customer_reviews.title: Control unit stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unit last year and it worked perfectly the entire 2018 season. However, this year, the control unit stopped working. Only the lift and plus/minus buttons work, the rest start/stop, cleaning cycle and pool shape do not. I have contacted their Tech Support line by email and phone. No response yet... Very disappointed and upset. This is a $1500 unit; I expected it to last at least 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use it in the pool for the first time but the control panel won't work. Nothing happens when I push any of the buttons on the display. Too late to return/exchange. I can't find a dealer who will service it since I didn't buy it from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product outstanding vendor
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new robotic pool cleaner to replace a broken one. Four Seasons Pool Supply had what I wanted at a great price. It arrived 2 days after I ordered it and went to work right out of the box. My daughter was so impressed with the performance that she ordered one for her pool. Four Seasons is our new goto dealer for quality and speedy delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Easy to set up, simple to use and extremely easy to clean after use. Does a good job cleaning the bottom and sides of our irregularly shaped pool. Only caveat is that it doesn't always get everything on the stairs and the remote control is a bit wonky, as it uses motion control. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Schmaltz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome robot
customer_reviews.text: This pool robot does as advertised. I own a 18'x36' in ground pool cleans the bottom and sides with ease. I have trees that over hang in one side of the pool so I always have debris in it. Picks up debris big and small. It climbs steps and walls no problem. I haven't used the 7 day cycle yet just because it's so easy to get in and out and put up. Awesome investment for pool owners
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Coomes

customer_reviews.title: If your buying it for the remote, pass
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model for the remote, but the remote is almost useless, very hard to control unit and sometimes doesn’t seem to connect
customer_reviews.author: Mike Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good device for a clean pool
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and works perfectly. Cords are plenty long in length. To cover even large pools. I’d recommend this to any pool owner.
customer_reviews.author: Mike K.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for my pool yet! This thing amazes me! It flips on its back or side and corrects on its own. It keeps our pool clean. Researched so much and was so torn with what to buy & so happy with it! So easy to clean and for a vacuum it is just what we need! Thank you Polaris!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing pool cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: I got the cleaner yesterday and have run it through five cycles. It picks up very little and the water coming out the back stirs everything up so it will never be truly clean. I'll be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Workes great.
customer_reviews.text: Cleans the pool great. I have a gunnite kidney shape and it works really well. Cleans the sides never gets stuck. When i 1st opened the pool i put this in and let it run for 4 cleaning cycles. Picked up leafs rocks and sand. The basket is so easy to clean. The lift feature works great. The remote works great. I really recommend this pool cleaner
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Ranieri

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cleaner in June 2017, now a week short of the 2 year mark, this cleaners engine mount had failed and will cost $650 plus to repair. Plus there’s something with the wheels that’s going to cost $80. So $730 total. So after 2 years, paying over $900 for the machine it’s a useless paperweight!
customer_reviews.author: Bellalicious

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: Died in less than three years. And the repair is as much as a new one. Into the trash it goes..smh. 1k in trash.lol. Crazy. Shame on this company. I treated it like royalty , took it out after cleaning, rinsed it, kept covered. Error 10. Was the only , and last code it ever received. Not even something simple for me to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Woodrome

customer_reviews.title: This is the second on Ive bought and had to ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second on Ive bought and had to return. The first always got an Error message. This is the new enhanced model and still I am gettting Error 04. Polaris is even having difficulty diagnosing and the customer service tech in Easton doesnt andswer their phone to drop off
customer_reviews.author: Benjino

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working.  No answer on the  Customer Service line 800-822-7933
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. I am very unhappy with the customer service. No answer for the last couple of weeks we've been trying to get this item serviced. We just hit our 1 year mark. The wheels on the left side of this Polaris stopped working as well as the the front roller or wheel. Invest your $1000 in a different pool cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: When it’s good it’s good, but misses a lot too.
customer_reviews.text: Where it cover’s it cleans well. But where it misses, even with an increased amount of time it consistently misses. The hand held device to try to drive manually is difficult to use and the machine is slow to respond.
customer_reviews.author: BColvin

customer_reviews.title: Get the fine filter ...best for grit.
customer_reviews.text: Just wow! We set it for 2 hours per use and when we return the pool is spotless. Our pool guy had to lower his fee due the effectiveness of the Polaris.
customer_reviews.author: Technical T

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product! We have been using it daily in our pool since we got it. It is so much better than what we had before. The price, delivery, everything about this transaction was A+. We highly recommend the Polaris F9550 Robotic for your unground pool.
customer_reviews.author: rl

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for 1 month, then the control unit stopped working. Some water got into it after a rainy day, even though it is supposed to be water resistant. I would expect something like this to be covered by a warranty, but it's not. After initially saying that I would have to buy a new one, they ended up replacing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: live is much easier.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second sweeper, I think there great. Make sure you get 1 with the fine mesh basket.
customer_reviews.author: carl

customer_reviews.title: ... cleaned walls and every surface on my pool very good, but no stairs or levels that are not ...
customer_reviews.text: This unit vacuumed and cleaned walls and every surface on my pool very good, but no stairs or levels that are not 1 feet deep. The only thing is that the remote or wand disconnects from the receiver and when you want to put the unit out of your pool it's hard. The remote needs a better signal, or some kind of improvements.
customer_reviews.author: Jose M. Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I've had it about 3 months now. Cord has never tangled. If it flips upside down it will, what looks like magically, flip itself back up right. Climbs and cleans the walls easily. I don't really use any of the fancy features like the remote or timing but because I don't need to. Put it in, whatch a movie, take it out... clean pool!! Taking it out is really easy too. Push a button and it will climb to the waterline and wait for you to pick it up. As long as it doesn't break down any time soon, it will have been well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE THE POLARIS SPORT 9550
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product on 07.15.19 and it worked good until 06.01.20. Now it has been at the dealership since last week and no one from Zodiac will return my call. The dealership said it has no power, the cord motor failed and EBox failed as well. You can call and leave your number, no one will call you back. You can sit on hold for 2 hours and no one will call you back. DO NOT BUY this plastic piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy Robot Pool Cleaner!!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used the F9550 for Two-months now. Great product. It keeps my pool exceptionally clean and makes the overall pool maintenance process a breeze. Highly recommend Zodiac design a better cable management system to make it easier to coil the unit when you are done.
customer_reviews.author: DWR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pool cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry, use, wash off and store. Not cumbersome for female to lift or manage. Works great to pick up small and medium debris including pine straw. Like having a pool cleaning service on standby. Had for 1 year already. Definitely worth the sale price
customer_reviews.author: Rob Strano

customer_reviews.title: Great Product.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this unit! I bought one from a different manufacturer, was hugely disappointed (my review is posted) and sent it back. I ordered this one the same day. It has exceeded my expectations. I'm watching it scrub my steps as I post this. Easy set up, it comes with a caddy and has a remote. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K

customer_reviews.title: Really great product
customer_reviews.text: Had a wheel missing but the company sent one and the product is better than expected. Highly recommend this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: Baker

customer_reviews.title: It did a great job. I bought the Polaris 9450 for myself
customer_reviews.text: I've used a Turbo T4 for the last four years. It did a great job. I bought the Polaris 9450 for myself. It doesn't seem to hold as many leaves but the left button and a five minute turn around is worth a lot. The factory timers (walls/no walls) is good for me. I like the cart that comes with it and the cable is easier to wind up. When opening my pool this year, with slimy algae, the sand filter and robot did 95% of the work. Shock, a lot of it, 30lbs at three different times, and a little brushing from me and now my pool looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... Eminem 5 days the pool was spotless i would recommend any one to buy this product over any other ...
customer_reviews.text: This pool vac Works incredibly well we purchased a new home the pool has not been opened in two to three years we got to the pool everyday Eminem 5 days the pool was spotless i would recommend any one to buy this product over any other pool vacuum
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Polaris F9550 Sport Robotic In-Ground Pool Cleaner
product_meta.description: Model:F9550Polaris 9550 is a progressive, inspirational 4-wheel drive robotic cleaner. Its aquadynamic design combines commanding styling, inventive engineering, and intelligence for a truly impressive cleaner. The cleaner is outfitted with Aqua-Trax tires for all pool surfaces and features ActivMotion Sensor Technology for unmatchable navigation, even in larger and free-from pools. The 9550 Sport features oscillating brushes that scrub away stubborn dirt and stains and Proprietary Vortex Vacuum Technology that allows the cleaner pick up larger debris quickly while maintaining maximum suction. Debris is easily removed from the top of the cleaner which features a lid and large capacity filter canister, eliminating the need for messy bags. The forceful rear water propulsion system allows this agile cleaner to reach debris under stairs and in tight corners while improved power gets the job done fast. Best of all, the 9550 includes a 7-day programmable timer, pre-programmed cleaning patterns, and a motion sensing hand held remote. The cleaner also includes a heavy gauge, powder coated alloy caddy for storage and transport. Includes 110v transformer, 60ft cord, and filter canister. Waterline only Cleaning Cycle - For isolated tile line scrubbing.
feature_bullets: 4-wheel drive robotic cleaner outfitted with Aqua-Trax tires for all pool surfaces
ActivMotion Sensor Technology for unmatchable navigation, even in larger and free-from pools.Cable Length:70 feet Cable
Vortex Vacuum Technology allows cleaner to pick up larger debris while maintaining maximum suction
Rear water propulsion system allows cleaner to reach debris under stairs and in tight corners
It is compatible with any of the IntelliTouch, EasyTouch and SunTouch remote control systems to control the IntelliFlo pump remotely
Includes 7-day programmable timer, hand held remote and powder coated alloy caddy. Remote control : Yes. Motion-Sensing ; Cable Length 70' Cable / 60' Pool

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars598 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
